quote: Every person is wanted, and no person is wanted much.
author: Emerson

quote: Gain not base gains; base gains are the same as losses.
author: Hesiod

quote: The boy called out 'Wolf, Wolf!' and the villagers came out to help him. A few days afterward he tried the same trick, and again they came to his help. Shortly after this a wolf actually came, but this time the villagers thought the boy was deceiving them again and nobody came to his help.
author: Aesop

quote: None love the messenger who brings bad news.
author: Sophocles

quote: No evil can happen to a good person, either in life or after death.
author: Socrates

quote: They who are of a calm and happy nature will hardly feel the pressure of age, but to they who are of an opposite disposition youth and age are equally a burden.
author: Plato

quote: Perhaps some day it will be pleasant to remember even this.
author: Virgil

quote: Each of us suffers their own hell.
author: Virgil

quote: Appetite comes with eating, says Angeston.
author: Rabelais

quote: People fear death as children fear to go in the dark; and as that natural fear in children is increased with tales, so is the other.
author: Bacon

quote: I think that cars today are almost the exact equivalent of the great Gothic cathedrals I mean the supreme creation of an era conceived with passion by unknown artists, and consumed in image if not in usage by a whole population which appropriates them as a purely magical object.
author: Roland Barthes
